definition: Taiwan independence/(of Taiwan) to declare independence

sentences.english: Lee assuredWen that his country insists on the one-China policy and opposes Taiwanindependence.
sentences.chinese: 李向温重申坚持一个中国的政策，反对台独。

sentences.english: Wen is likely to push U.S. President George W. Bush's Administration to make clear its opposition to Taiwan's independence.
sentences.chinese: 温家宝很可能要求布殊总统明确表明反对台独立场。

sentences.english: Taiwan's pro-independence has a tendency to assault Mainland China and declare to be independent while China is being abstracted. (under the status of distraction. )
sentences.chinese: 台独分子想借着中国无法分心的时候攻打中国和独立。

sentences.english: True, China has ratcheted up the threats against Chen and other pro-independence diehards.
sentences.chinese: 没错，北京进一步威胁陈水扁和其他顽固台独分子。

sentences.english: Taiwan's pro-independence may intend to assault mainland China and declair independent while China is being distracted.
sentences.chinese: 台独分子想借着中国无法分心的时候攻打中国和独立。

sentences.english: China considers Lee a leading figure among Taiwanese independence activists.
sentences.chinese: 中国认为李登辉是台独分子的首要人物。

definition: DPP (Democratic Progressive Party, Taiwan)/abbr. for 民主進步黨|民主进步党
Tsai Ing-wen (1956-), Taiwanese DPP politician, president of the Republic of China from 2016
1992 Consensus, statement issued after 1992 talks between PRC and Taiwan representatives, asserting that there is only one China
One-China principle, the official doctrine that Taiwan is a province of China
to unify by using military force (usu. in relation to Taiwan)
Lee Teng-hui (1923-2020), Taiwanese politician, president of ROC 1988-2000
Chen Shui-Bian (1950-), Taiwanese DPP 民進黨|民进党 politician, president of the Republic of China 2000-2008
Mainland Affairs Council (Taiwan), abbr. for 大陸委員會|大陆委员会
abbr. for 立法委員會|立法委员会[li4 fa3 wei3 yuan2 hui4]/abbr. for 立法委員|立法委员[li4 fa3 wei3 yuan2]
Ma Ying-jeou (1950-), Taiwanese Kuomintang politician, Mayor of Taipei 1998-2006, president of Republic of China 2008-2016
